What we did Working principles

Ability - Insight #17

Not everyone has the skills, time or tools to do risk well

We believe...

Some people find it hard to identify what they need to do because they don’t have easy to understand guidance, training or tools that guide them through.

Because we've seen and heard...

"5-10% of my role is filling out a spreadsheet that has no benefit to my team"

I have written my own risk management document which explains how to do it

"Reading is one thing, understanding and linking it to the real thing is harder"

It would be more helpful if it was distilled into key actions

Hard to find the key things I need to do my job

Related user needs

View all

User need #3

As a Co-op manager
I need to feel confident that my team are managing our risks
So that I can get on with delivering, and not feel I need to worry about risk

User need #4

As a Co-op manager
I need to be able to see all risks that could impact my areas
So we can take action to reduce the impact and likelihood

User need #8

When I’m managing risk
I need to be able to find and interrogate all the relevant data to me, my area and my role
So that I can improve my understanding and identify patterns

User need #10

When I’m managing my risks
I need to be able to work in the most efficient way possible
So that I’m not wasting time on things that don’t add value

User need #11

When I’m managing risk
I need to be able to identify and record links and interdependencies
So that I can build a clearer picture of the landscape

User need #13

When I’m managing risk
I need to know that I’m doing the right thing
So that I don’t feel worried or concerned

User need #14

When I’m managing risk
I need to feel I’m doing a good job
So that I feel a sense of purpose and reward

User need #15

When I’m managing my risks
I need to know what to do and how to do it
So that I can manage the risks in the most appropriate way

User need #16

As a risk colleague
I need to be able to influence decisions that impact me my role and the tools we use.
So that I can ensure they help me work efficiently and effectively.

Observation #2

Risk colleagues find sharing how they manage risk hard and daunting, necessitating BPs to act as guides and interpreters.

Observation #3

The tools we provide for Risk colleagues make it hard for BPs to review and challenge.

Observation #4

The Risk Register in particular inhibits Risk colleagues in sharing how they manage risk.

Observation #6

Risk colleagues find central Risk Management language hard to understand.

Observation #10

When Risk colleagues are looking at a risk rating they need to be able to see what it relates to.
